resources.string: Hello there! Rough landing, wasn't it? \n\nUm, wow! You're actually looking quite… healthy, all things considered. Luckier than most!
"Were you on the ship?"
Oh no! Well, a long, long time ago, I was, but I've been here for… many years.\n\nWatcher Leyson Reese, at your service.
"Nice to meet you. I'm {playerName}."
It's nice to meet you as well.\n\nThough, to be completely honest, I wish it were under better circumstances.
An Unpleasant Task
"Why are you here?"
I came from the Everfall Settlement to check the beach after the nasty storm that sank your ship. \n\nAnd to deal with your less fortunate crewmates, I suppose.
"What happened to them?"

Ah, well, you came through death alright, but they came back soulless Lost, the 'Drowned'. \n\nIt's an unpleasant task, but I could use help at least trying to put them back to rest… if you're willing, of course.
Check your map and hunt down those undying unfortunates in the shipwreck. \n\nTry not to lose yourself in the process, and count yourself lucky you're not among them.
Yes, it's grim work, but I hope it gave you a little closure.\n\nHey, ready to embrace your new life on Aeternum? You'd be surprised - some of it is actually quite... nice.
Defeat the soulless Drowned and try to put them back to rest, and report back to Watcher Reese at the Everfall Watchtower.
Open the Map (default: [M])
Investigate the Shipwreck marked on your map
Defeat {targetName}
Feeling Welcome
"Do you have any supplies?"
Like I said, I didn't think to bring along mead, but I do hope you feel welcome. \n\nWarm yourself by the fire. Cook something if you like.
"Got anything to cook?"
Sorry, but there's some delicious boar nearby.\n\nGet some flint and wood, make a skinning knife at the fire, and then I'll point you in the right direction.
Flint, wood, skinning knife. Then we're good to go.
Very impressive. One of the best crude skinning knives I've seen.\n\nYou've done this before, haven't you?
Gather Flint and Wood, then craft a Flint Skinning Knife at the Watcher's Campfire, and then talk to Watcher Reese.
Collect Materials
Gather {itemName} from the ground
Gather Wood from a bush
Craft a {itemName} at the Watcher's Campfire
A Proper Feast
"I'll get to it then."
And now you're all-set to go on a little boar hunt. They're ornery, but I think you can handle it. \n\nHunt one down, skin it, and cook yourself some rations. You deserve it.
Mmm. Boar.
Mmm, that smells delicious. You're lucky you washed ashore in Everfall. \n\nWe have the tastiest game, and really the best-tasting food in general.
Hunt and skin a boar and make some light rations at the Watcher's campfire, and then talk to Watcher Reese.
Hunt down a {targetName} to make yourself a meal
Equip a Skinning Knife
Skin a Boar to Collect {itemName}
Cook a Light Ration at the Watcher's Campfire
Legacies of the Storm
"What can I do to help?"

You probably already realized this, but the storm that wrecked your ship and others - it wasn't exactly... natural.\n\nCorruption. Always been a fact of life here, but honestly, that was the worst storm I've ever seen.
"Is there still a threat?"

That's the question. We need to be sure. \n\nWe also need to gather records from these ships. So maybe you can help with that and look for any lingering bits of that nasty Corruption? It would mean a lot.
I know this has probably been a difficult day, but there is a silver lining.\n\nYou're not dead, and your soul's intact, as well. And we have excellent mead… at the settlement.
There we go. Thank you. Remembering the ships that crashed here is kind of a tradition in Everfall. \n\nIt may seem a bit silly, but it helps us feel connected to the Old World.
Search for survivors and bring back any records or remnants from the shipwrecks. Watch for signs of Corruption as well. Report back to Watcher Reese at the First Light Watchtower when you're done.
Search Shipwrecks for Records and Remnants
From Huang's Hammer:
Collect Ship's Roster
Collect Ship's Manifest
Collect Ship's Log
Search Ship's Locker at wreck of {POITags}
From the Harpy of Henninger:
Collect the {itemName} from the Stern
Collect the {itemName} from the Bow
Investigate {POITags}
Search for the Source of the Corruption
Defeat the {targetName}
This is Not Good
"Not good?"
To be more precise, in fact, it's a bit of a disaster.\n\nIf the Corruption gets entrenched down here, it'll reach the settlement in no time.
"What can we do?"

Simple. We have to find the source and destroy it. Whatever it is, I think it's in the Undertow Cave.\n\nI won't complain if you go investigate, but just… be careful. Anything Corrupted is insanely dangerous.
If you're willing to venture into that cave, be careful. And remember - I didn't ask, you volunteered!
This is… wow! You really took down that Corrupted… thing without any backup?\n\nI have to say, I am really impressed, {playerName}.
Explore the Undertow Cave, search for the source of any lingering Corruption, and eliminate it. Report back to Watcher Reese at the First Light Watchtower when done.
Bearer of Bad Tidings
"That's good to hear."
That said, the settlement can't ignore this. There's no doubt the Corruption is getting worse. \n\nThat cup of mead is calling, but I really should stay.
"Can I take the message?"
Was I that obvious? I hate to ask you to be the bearer of bad tidings, but you're a likeable sort, it'll make it easier. \n\nTake my report to Constable Maecia so she understands the situation.
The settlement is due east of here, and should be easily spotted on your map. Have you lost your way already?
Hello there, I'm Maecia. Tell me - how are things outside? \n\nThere was the storm and then Shattered Mountain started spewing Corruption... it's bad, isn't it?
"Here's the report from Watcher Reese."
Oh, fiddlesticks! I knew this would happen! It's all my fault!\n\nI'm in a decades-long string of bad luck! Everything I touch turns to dung. And now this.
Travel to the Everfall settlement and deliver Watcher Reese's report to Constable Maecia.
Truffle Fever
Collect any Truffles you can find in the forest and bring them to Hapless Howe in the settlement. Look for any Herbs or Berries you can gather as well.
"Why would they do that?"
How should I know? Do I look like some kind of "boar-mind-reader"? Not me. I'm just a simple Traveling Herbalist.\n\nTell you this much, however, the beasts have ruined me for the season.
"Any way I can help?"

You mean… you'd help old Hapless Howe? Why yes! You're a saint! Take my sickle, hunt up some Truffles, and bring them to the settlement.\n\nGather any herbs or berries you see for yourself as well - they'll fetch a gold or two at the Trading Post!

Sad days are these when a traveling Herbalist has to rely on the goodwill of a stranger to make ends meet.\n\nBut if you'll bring me some truffles in the settlement, I'll have a little something for you.

Here's my new friend, right here! All the truffles I lost and then some! I hope it wasn't too hard!\n\nKeep that sickle for your troubles, and if you make a habit of Harvesting herbs and such, we'll cross paths again, no doubt.
Gather {itemName}s around the marked area
(Optional) Gather Herbs or Berries
Equip the Sickle from Herbalist Howe
The Corruption "Expert"
Search for an old man along the river in Monarch's Bluffs. He may know more about fighting Corruption.
"Where could we find an expert?"
These days? I'd have no idea. There was some old fool raving about Corruption many years ago.\n\nIf he's still around at all, you might look up in Monarch's Bluffs… but do help us here first!
Are you still looking for that old madman? I heard he was wandering around Monarch's Bluffs.
Complete Quests to Help the Settlement before Investigating Rumors
(Optional) Use Your Map to Fast Travel to the Spirit Shrine
Search for the Mysterious Old Man at {POITags}
The Magistrate's Counsel
"Alright. Who's in charge of defenses?"
Normally I am, but that would be very unwise. In fact, you should go, for your own sake.\n\nShare the report with Magistrate Clark. He'll know what to do.
You're better off talking to Magistrate Clark. Really.
A fine day to you, friend. I'm sure you saw the storm and the mountain, but let's keep our chins up. \n\nI expect a report from Watcher Reese any moment.
"I have Watcher Reese's report."

Oh, that can't be good, can it? Hm. Yes, this confirms our suspicions - the Corruption is indeed surging.\n\nI trust you're the {playerName} to whom Reese refers? Then you've already earned my respect.
Share the Watcher's report with Magistrate Clark.
A Warm Bed
Check in at Everfall's inn.
"How can I help?"
First priority is safety, both for the settlement and for you, {playerName}.\n\nYou've done your duty for Everfall and I salute you for that.
"Is there anything else?"
Perhaps, but I insist you check in at the inn first. \n\nWhether it's here, or another settlement, every soldier needs a warm bed.
Visit the inn and check in.
Ah, I hope you're feeling fully-rested now, if you needed that.\n\nEven during hard times, it's important newcomers feel welcome.
Check in at the Inn
Open the Storage Shed
Getting Acquainted with Everfall
Visit the trading post and check out the storage space available to you, and then report back to Magistrate Clark.
"It's yours… for now, at least."
If you wish to remain, you should get acquainted with our trading post. \n\nCheck the storage space I've made available for you, as well.
Trading Post and Storage Shed. You'll need them.
There now, I think you have the lay of the land. Hope you feel at home.\n\nI can't ask you to defend a place to which you have no loyalty.
Open the Trading Post
Simple Things
"We can still prepare. What's next?"
Next priority is the arsenal. Surely Maecia can handle the simple things.\n\nWhy don't you ask her advice on acquiring materials for the forge? Perhaps she'll be willing to risk that much, at least.
Let's hope Maecia can handle this much.
Oh, {playerName}! Tell me Magistrate Clark has everything under control!\n\nOr maybe it's better you don't say anything? I'm not sure. Not sure at all.
Talk to Constable Maecia about acquiring materials for the forge.
We Can Do This
Gather the materials Constable Maecia has requested and then refine them in town. Report back to the Constable when you're done.
"If that's what you prefer…"
But I am curious… did the Magistrate have any ideas? \n\nHe needs to proceed very carefully! Has he set any priorities?
"Yes, the Arsenal."
Forging new weapons? What fun. I was quite a craftswoman once. \n\nSuppose I could help, if you do the work. Yes, get us some stone, pelts, and wood as raw materials.
Fingers crossed this doesn't end in disaster. \n\nMaybe your luck will act as counterbalance against mine.
Go ahead, just get it over with… what happened?\n\nNothing? No freak boulders falling on you or anything like that? I can't believe it!
Complete Quest: Marshalling Resources
Complete Quest: Refined Tastes
Travel to the Town Projects board and accept an active Town Projects mission
Complete the Town Projects mission
Gather {itemName} by Mining Boulders
Gather {itemName} by Skinning Boars and Wolves
Gather {itemName} from Bushes or Trees
If this works, you can color me pink!
Get those raw materials and we'll see what we can do.
Use the tools given to you by the Constable to gather resource materials and bring them back.
Marshalling Resources
Craft {itemName} at Woodshop
Craft {itemName} at Stonecutting
Craft {itemName} at Tannery
Look at that! You're back and without any disaster.\n\nI'll be a pickled eggplant!
Let's give it a shot, though. We need these materials refined at the workshops around town. \n\nJust watch yourself out there. Don't go stepping on any cracks!
Are those raw resources refined into something more compact now? Refined materials take up less space in your pack.
Straight in from the workshops, are you? \n\nAnd you got it all refined. That's something, isn't it?
Visit the workshops and use the equipment to refine your raw resources.
Refined Tastes
Artificer Petrowksi
"Is that all for now then?"
I've pushed my luck far enough for today.\n\nTake this stuff to the Artificer. She'll set you straight alright. Go on. I'll be right here.
See Artificer Petrowski. She'll take it from here.
Take the materials you've refined to Artificer Petrowski in the Everfall Settlement.
So you're the newcomer Clark was talking about?\n\nDon't see what there is to be so impressed about myself.
Forging Ahead
"A little nervous, but she's alright."
Very well, looking at what you refined here, you might have some talent.\n\nLet's find out then, shall we? Here's a satchel of ore - smelt it and then try your hand at the forge.
You have the materials. There's the forge. Nothing more to say.
Visit the forge and craft an Iron Longsword, and then show your work to Artificer Petrowski.
Hmmph! Let me see this stick of metal you've produced.\n\nIndeed, it appears to be satisfactory… for a novice.
Gather Iron Ore
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge
Fancypants
"Anything else you need?"
Before you stray too far, I suggest introducing yourself to Survivalist Lee. \n\nI call him 'fancypants.' You'll have to ask him why.
Odnell Lee is his birth name, or so he claims. Talk to him, at any rate.
Introduce yourself to Survivalist Lee in the Everfall Settlement.
Ay, what have we here? A newcomer, I suspect, based on your attire.\n\nDid Tekla send you over to see old 'fancypants,' then?
"Why does she call you that?"
She pretends to be mocking me and my profound sense of fashion.\n\nTruth is, she's got a thing for me. One of these days, she'll confess to it.
Sharp Teeth, Fine Fur
"I can handle myself."
Of course you can, but I say a good warrior's got to test themselves every day.\n\nMaybe even venture out alone into the wilds of Aeternum.
"I wouldn't hesitate to do that."
Exactly, see? That's why I'd ask a favor of you. \n\nCollecting fine wolf fur for a blanket, so maybe you set up camp out there and do some hunting for good old 'fancypants.' What do you say?
Be careful outside these walls, friend. There's things out there more dangerous than wolves, that's for sure.
Set up camp outside the settlement and hunt Crawtick and Midnight Wolves to collect Fine Fur. Return to Survivalist Lee in the Everfall Settlement when your hunt is complete.
Now who's strutting around all fancy-like! \n\nI suspect you got some wolf fur in your pack, too. Yes, yes, this will do nicely.
Defeat {targetName} to collect {itemName}
Make camp to set a respawn point in the wild (default: [Y])
Make camp to set a respawn point in the wild (default: [Y])
Collect musk from the wolves of {POITags}
Slay {targetName} for {itemName}
Continue to {POITags} in search of the finest of furs
(Optional) Place the musk to lure out the Alpha of the Midnight Den
Slay {targetName}
Survive the wolves' assault and claim {itemName} from {targetName}
Place the musk to lure the alpha
Hold out against the guardians of the Midnight Den
Intermission
Defeat Ol' Grey
Rival Pack Musk
Report for Duty
"I know exactly what you mean."
But for today, that may not be an option for either of us.\n\nSergeant-Major Magistrate Clark wants you to report for duty, soldier. Ignore him if you want. I won't snitch.
Magistrate Clark's looking for you. Careful or he might have you saluting him soon enough.
Speak to Magistrate Clark in the Everfall Settlement.
So Odwell was able to track you down? Excellent.\n\nWe have a long way to go to strengthen the settlement's defenses.
New Alliances
"That makes sense."
Indeed, I've come to realize there are many capable, courageous soldiers in all three factions.\n\n And recently, these groups have become even more influential around here.
"We should talk to them."

We should. If we are going to defend this place against Corruption, their role will be critical. \n\nI suggest you speak to representatives from each faction and decide with which you would like to enlist.
Speak with the Marauders
Speak with the Syndicate
Speak with the Covenant
Speak with all three Faction representatives
Consult with the Magistrate
Meet with each of the three factions and decide which is best.
Meet with each faction's representative in the Everfall Settlement to decide which faction you wish to join.
Perfect timing. I do hope you have spoken with the faction representatives. \n\nI'm interested to hear which of them has earned your allegiance.
Marauder Initiation: Fallowhill Farms
"I am ready to accept it."

Do you have what it takes to be a Marauder? We do not abide weakness, for life here is not easy. \n\nOnly the strong are truly free. This is a land of limitless riches waiting for those bold enough to claim them. Are you bold?
"What must I do?"
Go forth and defeat the unworthy Fallowed who have taken over the once-industrious Fallowhill Farm. \n\nRecover the remnants of the farm's prosperity.
What are you standing around for? Prove yourself worthy of my time or abandon your attempt to honor this pact. Fallowhill Farm isn't going to cleanse itself.
Prove your worth to the Marauders by Battling the Corrupted at Fallowhill Farms. Report back to Commander Hoang in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
Excellent, you have returned! And with quite the haul of loot! \n\nPerhaps you are worthy after all.
"What happens next?"

Mark my words, the Withered are nothing compared to the true threat we all face. \n\nThe Withered have taken leave of their senses, but the Corrupted know language, munitions-building, and craftsmanship. But we will defeat them.
Battle the Corrupted at {POITags} for your Marauders Initiation
Defeat {targetName} at {POITags}
Search chests for {itemName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Syndicate Initiation: Bradbury Fields
"What's the challenge?"

By now you're sure to have seen the crimson Corrupted forces that terrorize this island of arcane mysteries. \n\nThe war between the Corrupted and the living is more important than any petty faction squabbles.
"What do you need?"
The Corrupted have overtaken a farm called Bradbury Fields. \n\nGo there and retrieve samples of the Corrupted seeds for the Syndicate's research.
Have you yet found any supplies from Bradbury Fields we could repurpose for the cause against the Corrupted? \n\nI await with baited breath to see what you find and bring back to me.
Face the Corrupted at Bradbury Fields and reclaim Alchemist KIts for your initiation into the Syndicate. Report back to Alchemist Olivera in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.

You have returned! The Corrupted are a malignant force that would conquer this island if given the chance.\n\nWith these seeds we shall research ways to use azoth in farming similarly to how the Corrupted use their red miasma.
"Was it helpful?"

You have aided our research by bringing these seeds. Uncovering more about our enemy always benefits us in the fight against them! \n\nIn time, the Syndicate will share more knowledge of such mysteries.
Face the Corrupted at {POITags} for your Syndicate Initiation
Battle the Ancient Guardians at {POITags} for your Covenant Initiation
Defeat Arcturian Ancient Guardians
Covenant Initiation: Arcturus
"What's your request?"
Only the Covenant has the strength of spirit to cleanse Aeternum for the benefit of all. \n\nDo not fall for the empty promises of others. Do you wish to feel the light of the Spark shine upon you?
"What do you need me to do?"
The Ancients and their Guardians have access to many wondrous items. \n\nYour task is to lay the Ancients Guardians at Arcturus to rest, and extract the Ancient Orbs so that we may cleanse the land.
Doubt not the truth of our purpose. Go lay those Ancient Guardians to rest so that the land may be free of their memories. \n\nBring the orbs to me so we may honor their properties.
Explore Arcturus and prove your worth to the Covenant through combat. Report back to Adjudicator Amano in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
You are glowing with the Spark of purpose! It is a great mercy to rid such beings of their faded existence. \n\nThese Ancient Orbs will prove valuable to our holy cause.
"And now?"
Now the true work begins in stopping the Corruption. \n\nYou have my thanks, and and the thanks of the Covenant.
Join the Marauders\n OR
Join the Syndicate\n OR
Join the Covenant
[BLANK]
I cannot make this decision for you.
Very well. Only time will tell whether you've made the right choice.\n\nBut I'm of no mind to judge. The settlement needs assistance from whichever faction will give it.
Decide which Faction you wish to join, and then speak to the appropriate Faction Representative to enlist.
Choose Your Allegiance
Talk to your Faction Representative and Select a Mission
Complete a Faction Mission from the Faction Board
I am still awaiting orders, but that is my concern.\n\nYou should get busy working with your new friends to defend the settlement, and indeed, all of Aeternum.
You've chosen your allegiance. Now go make it count.
I think you chose well in your allegiance. \n\nI hear you and your friends are already making a considerable difference. Thank you.
Speak to your Faction Representative to view and accept and complete at least one Faction Mission; then return to Magistrate Clark.
Commitment to the Cause
Encroaching Corruption
Scour the areas near the Everfall Settlement and destroy any Corruption nodules you find. Then report back to Constable Maecia in the Settlement.
N/A
N/A
N/A
Consult with Constable Maecia for an update on Corruption
Oh, thank the stars you've returned! These Corruption breaches are opening up as fast as we can close them.\n\nDid you find it bubbling up from the ground as well?
"Yes, but I destroyed them."
You've come through for us again, a real champion for Everfall it feels like we have with you.\n\nYou should consider buying a home here! It'll make it easier to return after you head out again.
"I'm heading out again?"

Hope so. That crazy old man who knew about Corruption - I heard he's got a fishing shack in Monarch's Bluffs.\n\nIt's a hike, but he might know something. Talk to the Innkeep before you go - they need a favor out that way too.
Search the listed areas and eliminate any signs of Corruption:
North of Arcturus Tower
Near the Salt Hollow
South of Longshadow Enclave
With a Little Luck
Collect Lucky Rabbit Feet for Barkeep Polly to make a charm for Constable Maecia. Report back to Barkeep Polly in the Everfall Settlement when you've collected all the rabbit feet.
"Confidence is a good thing."
It is, but confidence is in short supply around here. Poor Constable Maecia - afraid of her own shadow, obsessed with 'bad luck.'\n\n I've been trying to help her, but… no luck so far! Heh.
"Anything I can do?"
Well... I had this idea. Sounds a little bit silly, but sometimes that's what people need.\n\nIf you'll collect rabbit feet while you're out in the wilds, I'll make the Constable a lucky charm.
It's hard for Constable Maecia. When you're looking for bad luck, you see it everywhere. Let's get those rabbits' feet.
This is my lucky day, isn't it? I knew you'd come through.\n\nThank you, I'll make a charm for the Constable as soon as I get home.
Collect {itemName} by Hunting Rabbits
Researcher's Request
Defeat the Arcturian Regent in the Ancient Ruins of Arcturus. Report to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"Hasn't anyone ever studied them?"

They have, but all we know for sure is that the Ancients had knowledge that far surpasses our own.\n\nThere's a researcher in town named William Heron. He claims the Ancients knew ways of protecting against the Corruption.
"Should I speak with William?"
Most definitely, but do him a favor first, at the Tower of Arcturus.\n\nThere's one particularly nasty Guardian there preventing him access. Destroy it and tell William. He will be pleased.
Defeat the Arcturian Regent at {POITags} for William Heron
Defeat {targetName}
Destroy the Ancient Guardian leader at Arcturus and then tell William. This could change everything.

Hold on. Let me guess! You're not long here on the island. Sand. You've been at the beach, and…\n\nDust. You were in ruins. Arcturus even. Hmmph. I'd have been there myself, were it not for that nasty Regent.
"I defeated the Regent."
You did? You've done me an enormous favor, then.\n\nAh, the Magistrate, of course. Clark. Then he does see the possibility of my work. Well done.
Opening Supply Lines
Defeat Stonetooth Pirates in Stonetooth Terrace and their leader Master Henry by the river docks. Report back to Survivalist Lee in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"Why? You want some skulls knocked?"
I want to see if I can get Artificer Petrowski to crack a smile.\n\nShe had an order of supplies coming from Weaver's Fen, but it never made it.
"What happened?"

Well, I did some scouting, and it's the Lost Pirates of Stonetooth Terrace menacing the east road out there.\n\nIf you can thin their numbers and put down Master Henry, I think that'll make Tekla show us those pearly whites.
Confront Master Henry and the Lost Pirates at {POITags} for Survivalist Lee
Defeat Lost Stonetooth Pirates
Defeat {targetName} on the river docks
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Lost Longshadow Pirates
Master Henry and his Lost Pirates are still menacing the east roads. Something needs to be done.
Haha! You gave Master Henry the what for, didn't you? Let's hope that bastard stays down.\n\nLeave it to me to tell old Tekla. I appreciate your help, friend!
Reclaiming What Was Lost
Collect Riverworn Stone Charms from Lost Pirates in the Riverworn Grotto for Artificer Petrowski in the Everfall Settlement.
"Sounds like you really don't like him."
Absolutely not! I will not allow a man the likes of Odnell Lee distract me from my work.\n\nI have a project under way that may help defend against the Corruption.
"Is there some way I can help?"
Possibly. The townsfolk of Riverworn Grotto once carried Stone Charms that protected them. \n\nOf course, the town was overrun by the Lost, but who knows? Bring me some of these charms to study.
Collect Riverworn Stone Charms for Artificer Petroskwi at {POITags}
Defeat Lost Riverworn Pirates
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Riverworn Grotto. Stone Charms. That's what I need.
You've returned, and with my Stone Charms, I presume.\n\nWell done. I look forward to studying these.
Something to Prove
Destroy Corrupted in the Shadowmine Area and then speak to Survivalist Lee in the Everfall Settlement.
Defeat Corrupted at {POITags} to prove Survivalist Lee wrong
Defeat Corrupted
Defeat {targetName} in {POITags}
"He's still pestering you?"
Yes. It must be some bizarre, crude sense of humor that drives someone like Odnell Lee.\n\nThe man has the nerve to say I don't stand up for myself!
"Why would he say that?"
My former… friend fell to the Corrupted in the Shadowmine Area.\n\nIn fact, you could go there and exact vengeance. Then tell Odnell. Perhaps he'll finally leave me alone.
I must admit, I do get some pleasure at the thought of you taking vengeance against the Corrupted out there.
Tekla told me she sent you out to Shadowmine. You got her vengeance, did you? Indeed.\n\nI give up then. If she's happy on her own, I'll let her be.
An Anonymous Gift
Gather ore samples from silver nodes in Canary Mine. Report to Artificer Petrowski in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"I don't think that's the problem."
I got another idea worth trying. But for this one, you'll be the one doing the delivering. \n\nPetrowski's been wanting to get some ore samples from the Canary Mine.
"You want me to go?"
Yes, you're a quick one, aren't you? \n\nHere's the thing, though: when you give the ore to Petrowski, tell her it's an anonymous gift. That'll get her attention!
Gather Ore Samples at {POITags} as a gift to Artificer Petrowski
Gather {itemName}s from Glowing Stockpiles throughout {POITags}
Get those ore samples for Petrowski, but remember, it's an anonymous gift.
Back so soon? What's this? Ore from the Canary Mine?\n\nTell me right now - who put you up to this?
"It's an anonymous gift."
Nonsense! I didn't ask for this and I shouldn't accept it.\n\nI suppose it may help in my research however. Very well. Thank you.
Assessing the Enemy
Destroy Marietta Olcott and Recover Olcott's Medicinals. Report back to Magistrate Clark in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"Is there anything I can do?"
Some time ago, a very unfortunate affair with Corruption transpired at the Olcott family farm.\n\nI wonder if there may be clues there as to how we might fight it.
"What happened?"

Marietta Olcott became Corrupted. Her husband locked her in the farmhouse and tried various medicinals.\n\nThe rest of the family wound up becoming Withered. Go there, destroy Marietta, and recover the medicinals.
I only hope we might find some clue after defeating Marietta Olcott and recovering her husband's medicinals.
I see you've returned. Let's have a look at these medicinals.\n\nHm. Inoculations. I wonder if these might've been what caused the family to become Withered.
Recover the Medicinals at {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Defeat Withered at {POITags}
Ancient Contemplations
Defeat Ancient Guardians at Achernar in Monarch's Bluffs and return to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement.
"Don't you research this kind of thing?"
I do, and thanks to you I visited Arcturus and completed my research there.\n\nI'm almost certain the Ancients had methods of defending against the Corruption.
"What were these methods?"
That, my new friend, is what we must figure out.\n\nReduce the numbers of Guardians in the Achernar ruins, and I will go and continue my research there.
Collect {itemName}es from Elk Cows
Defeat Ancient Guardians at {POITags} for William Heron
Defeat Celestial Ancient Guardians
The ruins of Achernar are in the Monarch's Bluffs territory. Reduce the number of Guardians there, and I will go myself.
I can smell the Monarch's Bluffs pollen from here.\n\nWell done. I will begin preparations to visit Achernar myself right away.
Onward and Upward
Defeat Daybreak Withered and Collect Old Mementos from crates. Report back to Constable Maecia in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"I hope it helps."
It does. I suppose it's time for me to shrug off all this 'bad luck' business. \n\nI need to be taking some risks in life, making more contributions. I'm ready.
"Can I help somehow?"
You certainly can. My bad luck started when Daybreak Borough fell to the Lost.\n\nIf you could go and put down the Withered there and bring back some mementos, it'd make me feel better.
Go to {POITags} and defeat Withered to redeem Constable Maecia
Defeat {targetName}
Search chests for {itemName}s at {POITags}
I feel like I'm finally coming out from being under a grey cloud. Cleaning up what happened at Daybreak will restore the sunlight.
Well, there's a friend. All the way to Daybreak Borough and back with these mementos.\n\nThank you, {playerName}. Between you and Cecilia, I finally feel like myself again.
What Came Before
Defeat Rotcrop Withered and recover Tekla's Brooch. Then bring the brooch to Survivalist Lee in the Everfall Settlement.
"Isn't that what you wanted?"
I don't know. Perhaps I was too harsh on the man. I know I sometimes come off as a... cold fish.\n\nBut when you have loved and lost, it's hard to move on.
"Is there anything I can do?"

Yes. The 'friend' I spoke of before - Audrey Kelleher - she was more than a friend. I gave her my brooch.\n\nRecover the brooch from the Kelleher Farmstead and give it to Odnell. Maybe I will give him a chance.
Recover Tekla's Brooch from {POITags}
Search chests in {POITags} to find Tekla's Brooch
Defeat Withered at {POITags}
Audrey kept my brooch somewhere safe at the Kelleher Farmstead. \n\nOf course it could be anywhere on the grounds now.
Hello there, my rambunctious friend! What news do you have?\n\nA brooch, eh? It is…very pretty, but why give it to me?
"Tekla wants you to have it."
She… you mean, this… I don't know what to say. I'm moved.\n\nGiving her space was what she needed. Thank you, {playerName}. This means the world.
Enemy of My Enemy
Collect Bile from Bilemouth at Meadow Lake Fishery for Magistrate Clark in the Everfall Settlement.
"What else can we do?"
I've actually had a hunch about this for some time - that quite possibly the Lost and Withered are immune to Corruption.\n\nPerhaps something in their bodily fluids is resistant to it.
"We should find out."

Indeed, and I know how. The most foul Lost in Everfall are the Bilemouth at Meadowlake Fishery. \n\nIf you are willing, I would like samples of their Bile. Meantime, I will consult with Alchemist Olivera.
Collect Bile from {POITags} as a means to defend against Corruption
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
I know this task can be described as nothing less than disgusting, but the Bilemouth may hold the key to defending the settlement.
I'm very relieved to see you, {playerName}. These Corruption breaches seem to be appearing in greater frequency.\n\nWe must move quickly.
Tainting the Tainted
Deposit the Bile-Soaked Meat into the Gruel Barrels in the Ebonrock Quarry. Report back to Magistrate Clark in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"What's next?"
Alchemist Olivera studied the Olcott Medicinals and believes we are on to something.\n\nHe thinks we can use the Bile you've recovered to repel or even destroy the Corrupted.
"We should test it."

Yes. An even more disgusting task than before - we soak this meat in the Lost bile, and...\n\nThere, now take this and deposit it in the Gruel Barrels at the Ebonrock Quarry. The Corrupted will eat it, and hopefully, perish.
Make sure to wash your hands after depositing that meat into the Gruel Barrels. Don't want anything to happen to you!
There you are! I hope you have washed your hands. \n\nGuess what? I have already heard reports that the Corrupted are falling ill.
"Then it worked."
It did. Now I just need to find someone to coat the settlement walls in Bilemouth Bile. \n\nSomeone else, that is. You have done enough. The entire settlement is in your debt.
Sabotage the Corrupted Forces' food supply at {POITags}
Deposit the Bile-Soaked Meat into Gruel Barrels
Defeat Corrupted at {POITags}
Stars as Our Guide
Search chests at Ancient Lookouts Lupus, Norma, and Leo. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"Is that a compliment?"
Take it however you want. Now, here's what I've surmised: the Ancients had many advanced technologies at their disposal.\n\nSome may have been used for less... humane purposes. Others, for defense.
"Against the Corruption?"

That, we cannot yet be certain of. I am certain, however, the Ancients harnessed the power of the stars in this region using astrolabes.\n\nIf you can procure them from the towers Lupus, Norma, and Leo, I can begin my studies.
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Studying the astrolabes from Lupus, Norma, and Leo will give us answers. Perhaps not all of them, but it's a start.
Perfect, perfect, perfect. Let us see what you have here.\n\nYes, the Ancients were triangulating light to either transmit or generate energy.
Under the Same Stars
Search chests at Ancient Lookouts Hercules, Canis, and Ursa. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"Just tell me what you need."
I will need to see astrolabes from some of the other towers to reach further conjecture.\n\nLet's try Hercules, Canis, and Ursa. There is some cosmic symmetry at work here I'm not seeing yet.
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Studying the astrolabes from Hercules, Canis, and Ursa will give us answers. Perhaps not all of them, but it's a start.
Yes! Yes! This is the key. See here––these constellations line up perfectly with the towers.\n\nThe patterns aren't in the towers, but in the stars themselves.
Led By Stars
Search chests at Ancient Lookouts Monoceros, Lacerta, and Carina. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"I suppose so."
I'm sorry if this is becoming repetitive for you, but such is the nature of science!\n\nRecover the astrolabes from Monoceros, Lacerta, and Carina. We're getting closer.
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Studying the astrolabes from Monoceros, Lacerta, and Carina will give us answers. Perhaps not all of them, but it's a start.
Aha! And here's one of my theories proven - the consistent age of the dust! \n\nAt some point, the Ancient Guardians all went dormant. Fascinating! But... it doesn't help against Corruption.
Constellation Convergence
Search chests at Ancient Lookouts Draco, Orion, and Perseus. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"I'm beginning to have doubts."

Keep the faith, friend. I had hoped to avoid this, but it seems we must visit the last three towers. \n\nDraco, Orion, and Perseus. Retrieve their sky discs and we'll have our answers. I feel certain of it.
Studying the astrolabes from Draco, Orion, and Perseus will give us answers. Final answers.
Let's see here... that's it! It all adds up! The Guardians were put to sleep when the towers went active!\n\nThe towers provided defense for this region while the Guardians were dormant!
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Search ancient coffer at {POITags}
Center of the Stars
Search for an Armillary Sphere and defeat Starfallen Ancient Guardians at the Shattered Obelisk. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"Do you have any ideas?"

Not yet, and of course, the unfortunate fact is that everything points to the Shattered Obelisk as the epicenter.\n\nThose ruins are guarded by the Starfallen. I estimate the odds of even you getting in there to be very, very low.
"I can beat the odds."
You have to make your own choices.\n\nIf you can subdue the Starfallen in the Obelisk, look for an Armillary Sphere. That is the key that opens the door to the heavens.
Search for an Armillary Sphere at {POITags} for William Heron
Search {POITags} for an Armillary Sphere
Defeat {targetName}
I cannot encourage you to take this risk. Dying in the Shattered Obelisk may be more than a soul can bear.
Did you... really? To enter the Obelisk and return - It defies logic.\n\nLet me see the Armillary Sphere. Yes. Yes, this will activate the towers. Your part is done.
"That's everything?"
No, quite the contrary. I must say - I have never met my equal… until now.\n\nYour strength and dedication made this possible, not my intellect. I am honored to know you.
Between Innkeeps
"I'm the venturing type."
Perfect! Innkeep Suen over in Windsward owes me - I loaned him some azoth a while back.\n\nIf you'll go remind him of the debt, he'll pay the cost for you to fast travel back.
"Fast travel back?"
Well yeah. It just costs a little azoth… like everything else, right?\n\nBut yes, if you will remind Innkeep Suen of the debt and return, I'll give you a little azoth myself.
Greetings and welcome to Windsward! Wait, do I know you?\n\nOr have you come from Everfall? I had a feeling Kamau would send someone soon.
"Yes, she wants her azoth."

And you can assure her that I will send it shortly. We've had an influx of new arrivals lately.\n\nAnd of course, before you ask… here is enough azoth for you to fast travel back to Everfall. Godspeed!
I do appreciate you taking my request to Innkeep Suen.\n\nHe'll give you enough azoth to fast travel back.
Remind Innkeep Suen in Windsward of the debt he owes Innkeep Kamau in Everfall.
Fast Travel Home
[BLANK]
Open the Map and (optional) Fast Travel back to Everfall
Well now, that was quicker than I expected.\n\nTell me that rapscallion has the azoth he owes me…
"He says he'll send it soon."
He'd better, or I'll be sending you back!\n\nI appreciate you going all the way out there, {playerName}. As promised, here's a little more azoth. Oh, and you can keep your free room!
[BLANK}
Open your map and use the azoth from the Innkeep to fast travel back to Everfall.

Holding item to transport
Travel to {POITags}
Foreman's Ledger (Expedition)
Collect the Foreman's Ledger in Amrine Excavation. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"What happened to him?"

Simon led the expedition into the Amrine Excavation of Windsward many years ago, and never returned.\n\nI still say the real genius behind Simon was his Foreman, who mapped every Ancient Ruin in all Aeternum.
"What happened to the Foreman?"

Who knows? He never returned from the Excavation either. I assume they're both dead... or worse.\n\nSay though, if some bold soul such as yourself were to get me the Foreman's Ledger, I would offer a handsome reward.
The Amrine Excavation is a dangerous digsite, so you will likely need friends to safely explore it. \n\nDo not go in underprepared, unless you enjoy the experience of dying.
Is that it? His ledger? Fantastic! With this, I can learn a great deal!\n\nSome of the notes he made here… fascinating. Who knew?
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName}
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName}
Starstone of Shattering (Expedition)
Collect the Starstone Diadem from Greundgul the Regent inside the Shattered Obelisk. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"More to the Obelisk?"

Yes, the Foreman's notes suggest the existence of a side entrance that could actually allow a small group to get inside.\n\nCan you imagine the secrets hidden in there? You must go there for me! You must!
"What do you expect to find in there?"

The ledger speaks of a Starstone Diadem, apparently an artifact from the Ancient ruling class.\n\nThe power of such a thing would only be surpassed by its value to my research. Recover the Diadem for me, and I will give you its equivalent in exchange.

Oh, the possibilities! We could be unearthing an artifact that helps us fight the Corrupted, or at the very least gives us insight into the Ancients. \n\nPlease, make haste to the Shattered Obelisk so you might obtain this Diadem of power.

This is truly a momentous find. This Starstone Diadem seems to have denoted an Ancient Guardian of incredibly high ranking, a ruler of some sort! \n\nA regent, perhaps? Oh, I simply must get to studying it further.
Winter Warrior
Place the runestone halves on the altar to summon the Winter Warrior
